name: v2.2.6
body:
## Using bzlmod with Bazel 6 or later:

1. Add `common --enable_bzlmod` to `.bazelrc`.

2. Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "rules_oci", version = "2.2.6")
# For testing, we also recommend https://registry.bazel.build/modules/container_structure_test

oci = use_extension("@rules_oci//oci:extensions.bzl", "oci")

# Declare external images you need to pull, for example: 
oci.pull(
    name = "distroless_base",
    # 'latest' is not reproducible, but it's convenient.
    # During the build we print a WARNING message that includes recommended 'digest' and 'platforms'
    # values which you can use here in place of 'tag' to pin for reproducibility.
    tag = "latest",
    image = "gcr.io/distroless/base",
    platforms = ["linux/amd64"],
)

# For each oci.pull call, repeat the "name" here to expose them as dependencies.
use_repo(oci, "distroless_base")
```

## Using WORKSPACE:

```starlark

load("@bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")

http_archive(
    name = "rules_oci",
    sha256 = "5994ec0e8df92c319ef5da5e1f9b514628ceb8fc5824b4234f2fe635abb8cc2e",
    strip_prefix = "rules_oci-2.2.6",
    url = "https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/releases/download/v2.2.6/rules_oci-v2.2.6.tar.gz",
)

load("@rules_oci//oci:dependencies.bzl", "rules_oci_dependencies")

rules_oci_dependencies()

load("@rules_oci//oci:repositories.bzl", "oci_register_toolchains")

oci_register_toolchains(name = "oci")

# You can pull your base images using oci_pull like this:
load("@rules_oci//oci:pull.bzl", "oci_pull")

oci_pull(
    name = "distroless_base",
    digest = "sha256:ccaef5ee2f1850270d453fdf700a5392534f8d1a8ca2acda391fbb6a06b81c86",
    image = "gcr.io/distroless/base",
    platforms = [
        "linux/amd64",
        "linux/arm64",
    ],
)
```


## What's Changed
* refactor: publish better buildx api by @thesayyn in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/788
* example: use docker tarball as base image by @thesayyn in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/789
* image_index.sh.tpl: use "dirname" from COREUTILS by @dmivankov in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/790
* chore: use new Publish-to-BCR by @alexeagle in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/792

## New Contributors
* @dmivankov made their first contribution in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/790

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/compare/v2.2.5...v2.2.6

name: v2.2.0
body:
## Using bzlmod with Bazel 6 or later:

1. Add `common --enable_bzlmod` to `.bazelrc`.

2. Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "rules_oci", version = "2.2.0")

```

## Using WORKSPACE:

```starlark

    name = "rules_oci",
    sha256 = "1bd16e455278d523f01326e0c3964cd64d7840a7e99cdd6e2617e59f698f3504",
    strip_prefix = "rules_oci-2.2.0",
    url = "https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/releases/download/v2.2.0/rules_oci-v2.2.0.tar.gz",

load("@rules_oci//oci:dependencies.bzl", "rules_oci_dependencies")

# You can pull your base images using oci_pull like this:

    name = "distroless_base",
    digest = "sha256:ccaef5ee2f1850270d453fdf700a5392534f8d1a8ca2acda391fbb6a06b81c86",
    image = "gcr.io/distroless/base",
    platforms = [
        "linux/amd64",
        "linux/arm64",
    ],
)
```

## What's Changed
* use compression in examples by @pdeva in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/718
* Add a plus sign to the output_groups option by @lexspoon in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/707
* refactor: remote_tags unnecessarily restrictive by @thesayyn in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/726
* Update scala.md: oci_tarball was renamed by @alexeagle in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/728
* doc: cover the inline-specified variants of arguments to oci_image by @plobsing in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/705
* fix: pass global args to all crane invocations by @ahans in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/709
* Introduce new attribute on `oci_image` for `created` datetime by @hanneskaeufler in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/724
* Fix macOS CI after #724 by @hanneskaeufler in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/730
* feat: Possible to skip cosign toolchains registration by @honnix in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/733
* chore: upgrade regctl by @alexeagle in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/744
* chore(cd): automate release tagging by @alexeagle in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/745
* chore(ci): disable two failing tests by @alexeagle in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/747
* chore: fix tag name when called by workflow by @alexeagle in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/749
* feat: Transition oci_image_index into a macro with additional [name].digest target by @mislavmandaricaxilis in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/742

## New Contributors
* @pdeva made their first contribution in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/718
* @lexspoon made their first contribution in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/707
* @ahans made their first contribution in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/709
* @hanneskaeufler made their first contribution in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/724
* @honnix made their first contribution in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/733
* @mislavmandaricaxilis made their first contribution in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/742

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/compare/v2.0.1...v2.2.0

name: v2.0.0
body:
## BREAKING CHANGES

- Uncompressed archives in the tars attribute is no longer compressed when creating the image, this might make images bigger compared to 1.x. Use pkg_tar#extension or tar#compress attribute to compress the layers beforehand.

```starlark
# For pkg_tar
pkg_tar(
  extension = "tar.gz"
)

# For tar
tar(
   compress = "gzip"
)
```

- Digests of images created 1.x rules_oci will not match 2.x rules_oci, as we are no longer use `crane` tool to create the images. However, images should stay the same semantically. You can use [diffoci](https://github.com/reproducible-containers/diffoci) to make sure they are the same semantically!
- Default output of  `oci_tarball` is no longer a tarball, use a `filegroup` target to get the tarball.  See https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/548
- `oci_tarball` is renamed to `oci_load` to better reflect it's purpose. 
- Bazel 5 is no longer supported, and is not tested by the CI, we will not be accepting fixes for it.
- Delimiter for `cmd` and `entrypoint` changed from `,` to `\n`. See: https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/663


## SIGNIFICANT CHANGES

- `OCIImage` action no longer spins an ephemeral registry instance to mutate images locally, making it slightly faster. See design [document](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1wZEB9QFxyrydhLiafYbaJ0D7Jd2FZRZjvoTtx0B8-yY/edit?usp=sharing)
- oci_image now supports `zstd` compression
- Now oci_pull fetches blobs in parallel on `Bazel >= 7.1`

## API Removals

- oci_pull no longer has a `config_path` attribute, use `config` attribute instead. It was deprecated in 1.x.



## Using bzlmod with Bazel 6 or later:

1. Add `common --enable_bzlmod` to `.bazelrc`.

2. Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "rules_oci", version = "2.0.0")
# For testing, we also recommend https://registry.bazel.build/modules/container_structure_test

oci = use_extension("@rules_oci//oci:extensions.bzl", "oci")

# Declare external images you need to pull, for example: 
oci.pull(
    name = "distroless_base",
    # 'latest' is not reproducible, but it's convenient.
    # During the build we print a WARNING message that includes recommended 'digest' and 'platforms'
    # values which you can use here in place of 'tag' to pin for reproducibility.
    tag = "latest",
    image = "gcr.io/distroless/base",
    platforms = ["linux/amd64"],
)

# For each oci.pull call, repeat the "name" here to expose them as dependencies.
use_repo(oci, "distroless_base")
```

## Using WORKSPACE:

```starlark

load("@bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")

http_archive(
    name = "rules_oci",
    sha256 = "d007e6c96eb62c88397b68f329e4ca56e0cfe31204a2c54b0cb17819f89f83c8",
    strip_prefix = "rules_oci-2.0.0",
    url = "https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/releases/download/v2.0.0/rules_oci-v2.0.0.tar.gz",
)

load("@rules_oci//oci:dependencies.bzl", "rules_oci_dependencies")

rules_oci_dependencies()

load("@rules_oci//oci:repositories.bzl", "oci_register_toolchains")

oci_register_toolchains(name = "oci")

# You can pull your base images using oci_pull like this:
load("@rules_oci//oci:pull.bzl", "oci_pull")

oci_pull(
    name = "distroless_base",
    digest = "sha256:ccaef5ee2f1850270d453fdf700a5392534f8d1a8ca2acda391fbb6a06b81c86",
    image = "gcr.io/distroless/base",
    platforms = [
        "linux/amd64",
        "linux/arm64",
    ],
)
```


## What's Changed
* docs: simplify use of expand_template by @alexeagle in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/534
* chore: upgrade rules_go and gazelle by @thesayyn in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/541
* ci: only test with bazel 6, 7 by @thesayyn in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/533
* Add a minimal c++ example in doc by @rygx in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/516
* [docs] Add missing name to push examples by @ptxmac in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/513

name: v2.0.0-rc0
body:
## Using bzlmod with Bazel 6 or later:

1. Add `common --enable_bzlmod` to `.bazelrc`.

2. Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "rules_oci", version = "2.0.0-rc0")
# For testing, we also recommend https://registry.bazel.build/modules/container_structure_test

oci = use_extension("@rules_oci//oci:extensions.bzl", "oci")

# Declare external images you need to pull, for example: 
oci.pull(
    name = "distroless_base",
    # 'latest' is not reproducible, but it's convenient.
    # During the build we print a WARNING message that includes recommended 'digest' and 'platforms'
    # values which you can use here in place of 'tag' to pin for reproducibility.
    tag = "latest",
    image = "gcr.io/distroless/base",
    platforms = ["linux/amd64"],
)

# For each oci.pull call, repeat the "name" here to expose them as dependencies.
use_repo(oci, "distroless_base")
```

## Using WORKSPACE:

```starlark

load("@bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")

http_archive(
    name = "rules_oci",
    sha256 = "79e7f80df2840d14d7bc79099b5ed4553398cce8cff1f0df97289a07f7fd213c",
    strip_prefix = "rules_oci-2.0.0-rc0",
    url = "https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/releases/download/v2.0.0-rc0/rules_oci-v2.0.0-rc0.tar.gz",
)

load("@rules_oci//oci:dependencies.bzl", "rules_oci_dependencies")

rules_oci_dependencies()

load("@rules_oci//oci:repositories.bzl", "oci_register_toolchains")

oci_register_toolchains(name = "oci")

# You can pull your base images using oci_pull like this:
load("@rules_oci//oci:pull.bzl", "oci_pull")

oci_pull(
    name = "distroless_base",
    digest = "sha256:ccaef5ee2f1850270d453fdf700a5392534f8d1a8ca2acda391fbb6a06b81c86",
    image = "gcr.io/distroless/base",
    platforms = [
        "linux/amd64",
        "linux/arm64",
    ],
)
```


## What's Changed
* chore: remove deprecated config_path attribute by @thesayyn in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/666
* Fix for gnu xargs and send --verbose to other commands by @vinnybod in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/672
* fix: include examples by @thesayyn in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/682
* chore(docs): mention rules_multirun by @alexeagle in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/681
* refactor: mention url rewriter in oci_pull errors by @thesayyn in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/675

## New Contributors
* @vinnybod made their first contribution in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/672


## BREAKING CHANGES

- Uncompressed archives in the tars attribute is no longer compressed when creating the image, this might make images bigger compared to 1.x. Use pkg_tar#extension or tar#compress attribute to compress the layers beforehand.

```starlark
# For pkg_tar
pkg_tar(
  extension = "tar.gz"
)

# For tar
tar(
   compress = "gzip"
)
```

- Digests of images created 1.x rules_oci will not match 2.x rules_oci, as we are no longer using crane to create the images. However, images should stay the same semantically. You can use [diffoci](https://github.com/reproducible-containers/diffoci) to make sure they are the same semantically! 
- Default output of  `oci_tarball` is no longer a tarball, use a `filegroup` target to get the tarball.  See https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/548
- `oci_tarball` is renamed to `oci_load` to better reflect it's purpose. 
- Bazel 5 is no longer supported, and tested by the CI, we will not be accepting fixes for it.


## SIGNIFICANT CHANGES

- OCIImage action no longer spins an ephemeral registry instance to mutate images locally, making it slightly faster.
- oci_image now supports `zstd` compression
- Now oci_pull fetches blobs in parallel on `Bazel >= 7.1`

## API Removals

- oci_pull no longer has a `config_path` attribute, use `config` attribute instead. It was deprecated in 1.x.



**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/compare/v2.0.0-beta2...v2.0.0-rc0

```starlark
load("@rules_oci//oci:repositories.bzl", "oci_register_toolchains")

oci_register_toolchains(name = "oci")

# You can pull your base images using oci_pull like this:
load("@rules_oci//oci:pull.bzl", "oci_pull")

oci_pull(
    name = "distroless_base",
    digest = "sha256:ccaef5ee2f1850270d453fdf700a5392534f8d1a8ca2acda391fbb6a06b81c86",
    image = "gcr.io/distroless/base",
    platforms = [
        "linux/amd64",
        "linux/arm64",
    ],
)
```

## BREAKING CHANGES

- Uncompressed archives in the tars attribute is no longer compressed when creating the image, this might make images bigger compared to 1.x. Use pkg_tar#compression or tar#compress attribute to compress the layers beforehand.
- Digests of images created 1.x rules_oci will not match 2.x rules_oci, as we are no longer using crane to create the images. However, images should stay the same semantically.
- Default output of  `oci_tarball` is no longer a tarball, use a `filegroup` target to get the tarball.  See https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/548
- Bazel 5 is no longer supported.
- `oci_tarball` is renamed to `oci_load` to better reflect it's purpose. 

## SIGNIFICANT CHANGES

- OCIImage action no longer spins an ephemeral registry instance to mutate images locally, making it slightly faster.
- oci_image now supports `zstd` compression
- Now oci_pull fetches blobs in parallel on `Bazel >= 7.1`


## What's Changed
* feat: add support for settings volumes by @gzm0 in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/632
* refactor: rename oci_tarball to oci_load by @alexeagle in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/636
* fix: accumulate image manifests in oci_image_index by @seh in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/633
* tarball uses hermetic coreutils by @rickvanprim in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/635

## New Contributors
* @seh made their first contribution in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/633
* @rickvanprim made their first contribution in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/635

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/compare/v2.0.0-alpha5...v2.0.0-beta0

* fix: Add quay back to authn config  by @ankit-agarwal1999 in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/543
* docs: recommend rules_distroless by @thesayyn in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/546
* Fix #552 and update readme by @chokychou in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/554
* Reduce GHA caching by @alexeagle in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/557
* Fix oci_image failing with "%1 is not a valid Win32 application" by @bartoszpop in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/556
* chore: update aspect url by @gregmagolan in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/561
* chore: don't cancel concurrent main builds by @gregmagolan in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/563
* oci_push to support Windows builds by @bartoszpop in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/565
* Quotes removal from MEDIA_TYPE string. by @kczulko in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/577

* feat: Allow setting both tag and digest in oci_pull when reproducible is True by @mark-thm in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/587
* fix: fix race condition in oci_pull where bazel can write platform manifest contents to the cache entry for image index manifest by @gregmagolan in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/596

name: v1.7.5
body:
## Using bzlmod with Bazel 6 or later:

1. Add `common --enable_bzlmod` to `.bazelrc`.

2. Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "rules_oci", version = "1.7.5")
# For testing, we also recommend https://registry.bazel.build/modules/container_structure_test

oci = use_extension("@rules_oci//oci:extensions.bzl", "oci")

# Declare external images you need to pull, for example: 
oci.pull(
    name = "distroless_base",
    # 'latest' is not reproducible, but it's convenient.
    # During the build we print a WARNING message that includes recommended 'digest' and 'platforms'
    # values which you can use here in place of 'tag' to pin for reproducibility.
    tag = "latest",
    image = "gcr.io/distroless/base",
    platforms = ["linux/amd64"],
)

# For each oci.pull call, repeat the "name" here to expose them as dependencies.
use_repo(oci, "distroless_base")
```

## Using WORKSPACE:

```starlark

load("@bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")

http_archive(
    name = "rules_oci",
    sha256 = "56d5499025d67a6b86b2e6ebae5232c72104ae682b5a21287770bd3bf0661abf",
    strip_prefix = "rules_oci-1.7.5",
    url = "https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/releases/download/v1.7.5/rules_oci-v1.7.5.tar.gz",
)

load("@rules_oci//oci:dependencies.bzl", "rules_oci_dependencies")

rules_oci_dependencies()

load("@rules_oci//oci:repositories.bzl", "LATEST_CRANE_VERSION", "oci_register_toolchains")

oci_register_toolchains(
    name = "oci",
    crane_version = LATEST_CRANE_VERSION,
    # Uncommenting the zot toolchain will cause it to be used instead of crane for some tasks.
    # Note that it does not support docker-format images.
    # zot_version = LATEST_ZOT_VERSION,
)

# You can pull your base images using oci_pull like this:
load("@rules_oci//oci:pull.bzl", "oci_pull")

oci_pull(
    name = "distroless_base",
    digest = "sha256:ccaef5ee2f1850270d453fdf700a5392534f8d1a8ca2acda391fbb6a06b81c86",
    image = "gcr.io/distroless/base",
    platforms = [
        "linux/amd64",
        "linux/arm64",
    ],
)
```


## What's Changed
* image: allow .tar.zst extension on layer tar by @alexeagle in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/523
* chore: remove examples/ from published artifact by @alexeagle in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/524
* chore: remove dead code due to duplication by @alexeagle in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/522
* Support inheriting environment variable that's value contains = by @sfc-gh-mhazy in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/526
* Revert "feat: use link instead of copy for blobs in oci_image_index" by @thesayyn in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/525
* Revert "image: allow .tar.zst extension on layer tar" by @alexeagle in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/532
* Add cosign v2.2.3 by @loosebazooka in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/536

## New Contributors
* @sfc-gh-mhazy made their first contribution in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/526
* @loosebazooka made their first contribution in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/536

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/compare/v1.7.4...v1.7.5

```starlark
    name = "distroless_base",

    # values which you can use here in place of 'tag' to pin for reproducibility.
    tag = "latest",
    image = "gcr.io/distroless/base",
    platforms = ["linux/amd64"],
)

# For each oci.pull call, repeat the "name" here to expose them as dependencies.
use_repo(oci, "distroless_base")
```

## What's Changed
* refactor: update zot and use minimal binaries by @thesayyn in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/394
* feat: add exposed_ports to oci_image by @gzm0 in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/404
* fix: forward config_path to oci_pull by @thesayyn in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/424
* refactor: remove workdir workaround by @thesayyn in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/393
* feat: bump and assert crane version by @thesayyn in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/426
* Provide an example in the compatibility section by @brianduff in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/429
* chore: remove unused header dump by @thesayyn in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/431
* feat: support all hash algorithms by @thesayyn in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/433
* crane / zot launcher: kill registry serve process on shell exit by @malt3 in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/421
* perf: use hardlink by @thesayyn in https://github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_oci/pull/440
